body.name: All the Dangerous Things: A Novel
body.description: "Reader Vacker does a remarkable job voicing the main characters and keeping the tension high....Mystery and true crime fans will be drawn in and ultimately satisfied by this complex, tense tale read expertly by a talented narrator."—Booklist"[Karissa] Vacker switches easily between the higher female voices and the lower male voices, creating recognizable and believable characters.... Listeners will enjoy a gripping and twisty story." (AudioFile on Earphones Award winner A Flicker in the Dark)Following up her instant New York Times bestseller, A Flicker in the Dark, Stacy Willingham delivers a totally gripping thriller about a desperate mother with a troubled past in All the Dangerous Things.One year ago, Isabelle Drake's life changed forever: her toddler son, Mason, was taken out of his crib in the middle of the night while she and her husband were asleep in the next room. With little evidence and few leads for the police to chase, the case quickly went cold. However, Isabelle cannot rest until Mason is returned to her—literally.Except for the occasional catnap or small blackout where she loses track of time, she hasn’t slept in a year.Isabelle's entire existence now revolves around finding him, but she knows she can’t go on this way forever. In hopes of jarring loose a new witness or buried clue, she agrees to be interviewed by a true-crime podcaster—but his interest in Isabelle's past makes her nervous. His incessant questioning paired with her severe insomnia has brought up uncomfortable memories from her own childhood, making Isabelle start to doubt her recollection of the night of Mason’s disappearance, as well as second-guess who she can trust... including herself. But she is determined to figure out the truth no matter where it leads.A Macmillan Audio production from Minotaur Books. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It was a GREAT read!!
reviews.reviewText: Loved the unknowing….what was gonna happen next😍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I gave this domestic thriller 4 Stars!SUMMARYThis is quite a story. It starts out very sad, Isabelle’s baby Mason has been kidnapped and a year later there are still no clues as to what happened to him. It has been effected every aspect of her life. She and her husband are separated, she cannot work. She cannot function. She spends all her time searching for him, she speaks at conventions and has turned her house into search headquarters. Literally can do nothing else. She doesn’t sleep, she has accused a couple people of being involved. She doesn’t come off as very stable.To make things even more complicated, she grew up in a house that was a civil war hospital at one time and it may or may not be haunted. And her baby sister died mysteriously when they were very young.Some people, maybe even the local police wonder if she had anything to do with Mason’s disappearance.Desperate and sleep deprived, she meets a true crime podcaster who wants to feature her story. As they work together, she starts to see things from a different point of view and begins to doubt everything she thought about the kidnapping.WHAT I LOVEDThis book had everything I like, in a thriller. There was an old historic home that was potentially haunted. There was a solid mystery with some good twists and turns. The characters were three-dimensional. Even the heroine of the story definitely had some gray areas in her life. I love a story with some very complicated relationships. This one definitely had that. I loved the setting, it had a very Southern Gothic feel.WHAT I DIDN’T LOVEFamily thing I can say I really didn’t like about this purpose that it started out. Very sad. The first maybe 50 or so. Pages were hard to read and I almost gave up. I’m glad I didn’t because the story stopped focusing just on how desperately sad Isabellle was, and started to get more into the mystery and suspense.OVERALLI would definitely recommend this book to anybody who likes a nice twisty roller. Just be prepared for the beginning to be sad and hard to read.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars the book is good

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This book is heart wrenching
reviews.reviewText: A story about about a mother's desperate attempt to find her missing son who'd been abducted one year earlier from his bed in the middle of the night. All the while battling severe sleep deprivation and guilt as well as coming to terms with her crumbling marriage. As if that weren't enough, repressed secrets from her past threaten to break her..I love the authors writing, it can be very poetic. The short chapters make the storie feel fast paced, though I'd say it's more medium paced. There is enough mystery and enough questions that I just couldn't put this down. I had my own theories but they proved to wrong and there was a surprising twist which I always love. I feel like the story was wrapped up nicely in the end and left no loose ends..I read the authors first book, A Flicker in the Dark, and jus couldn't pass up reading this one. I'm glad I did! I will definitely be reading more of her work in the future!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars could use more suspense
reviews.reviewText: Rather slow moving, predictable book. I wasn’t mesmerized by the plot or the characters. Not planning on reading more by her

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great book. The book club loves it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really loved this one. It kept me guessing and I didn’t want to put it down. Isabelle Drake’s toddler son, Mason, was kidnapped from his crib in the middle of the night. She hasn’t slept a full night since. She is determined to find out what happened to her son. I felt like I couldn’t trust any of the characters and I loved the ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved it, have loved both her books but this one gripped me from the start, and loved the twists ans turns. Can’t wait for her next one.
Very repetitive, shallow story streched out endlessly. The author is repeating the same thoughts agai and again, it is hard that keep on reading..
A great read! There were so many twists and turns in this book, I didn’t know what to believe. Then the twist at the end was extremely unexpected.I definitely recommend this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I don't think it will set the world on fire, but it's a good story and well written. It's a little difficult at times to read, the protagonist has a tough life and gotten into some strange situations. But Ben is no help at all!
